com.esri.mo2.map.img
Interface ImageReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
BNDImageReader, DummyImageReader, GISImageReader, IMGImageReader, JAIImageReader, MrSIDImageReader, NITFImageReader, RLCImageReader, RPFImageReader, SUNImageReader
public interface ImageReader

This interface defines an access to image readers that implemented in image PlugIns. The example how to use it:


 ImageReader imageReader = new JAIImageReader();
 String[] list = imageReader.getListOfExtension();
 for( int i = 0; i < list.length; i++ ) {
   System.out.println("support extension : " + list[i]);
 }
 imageReader.setFilename("/temp/image.gif");
 boolean bHeader = imageReader.readHeader();
 if( bHeader ) {
   int width = imageReader.getWidth();
   int height = imageReader.getHeight();
   System.out.println("image width=" + width + " height=" + height);
   AffineTransform affineTransform = imageReader.getAffineTransform();
   System.out.println("worldfile defines affine transform object =" + affineTransform);
   String projection = imageReader.getProjection();
   Image image = imageReader.readBody();
   draw(image) ...
 }

Image reader classes are organized in PlugIns. Use class ImageSupport to find which PlugIns are presented in the system.

See Also:
ImageSupport

getAffineTransform

public AffineTransform getAffineTransform()
The method returns AffineTransform object for image. If the worldfile is not present then default AffineTransform object will return.

Returns:
AffineTransform

Get image projection.

getWidth

public int getWidth()
Return image width. You should call readHeader method before.

Returns:
Intefer image width.

public int getHeight()

The method invoke the process to read file header.

Returns:
